result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Attorney Ann Larson to Judge Dietz re: bail conditions
Letter to Judge Dietz.

11:37 AM Defendant William Allen Berlin Jr. in court.  Attorney Ann M. Larson in court for William Allen Berlin Jr.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail to remove the condition "Defendant is not to be outside of his residence except for attending school and for employment purposes." Attorney Larson adds to her written motion. State reads a written statement from the victim and asks the court to deny the motion. The court amends the bond to permit the defendant to attend counseling. Attorney Larson to draft the motion.
Bail/bond hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter in Support of Bond Modification
Bail Motion.

ADDRESS INFO for William Allen Berlin Jr.
Current: 1325 N. 8th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 09-07-2022)
Prior: 2006 Rankin Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Order Modifying Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond is modified from $5,000.00 cash to $50,000.00 recognizance bond.  As further conditions of bond ordered by the Court, the defendant shall adhere to curfew by remaining in his residence at all times that he is not in school or at work.  All other conditions remain the same.

3:06 pm - Defendant William Allen Berlin Jr. appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for William Allen Berlin Jr.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. There was no inducement.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed.  
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Parties argue.
The Court modifies bail to $50,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with M.D.S., DOB: 10-22-2009, her residence or any member of her family, no contact with anyone under the age of 18 and defendant is not to be outside of his residence except for attending school and for employment purposes.
Attorney Larson to draft order.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:40 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Allen Berlin Jr. appeared by video, in custody, from the Manitowoc County Jail.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-06-2022
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree sexual assault of a child, engaging in repeated acts of sexual assault of the same child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with M.D.S., DOB: 10-22-2009 her residence or any member of her family and defendant must have no contact with any person under the age of 18.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
